sense.name: place into the hands of, give
sense.commentary: Includes: HAND OVER, HAND IN, HAND OUT
sense.examples: Ever the optimist, Norman handed the barber the magazine clipping of Tom Cruise. The new president was handed the reins of the government yesterday. Mr. Big reportedly invited her to the bar and handed over a check for 1 billion dollars. People around here have handed out flyers for the big festival. Entirely failing to hand in homework will get you a zero for the assignment.

sense.name: guide, conduct or usher someone somewhere
sense.examples: 'Goodbye Fanny,' he said as he started to hand me into the carriage. Mary handed him into the small parlor so he could wait for the Earl.
